Sign up for the mailing list

04 Mar 2014

The school only allows singups via our old rusty list serve. Here are instructions to help you out.

We send out important information about our events, workshops, talks and meetings via email on our mailing list. To stay in the loop, we highly recommend subscribing to the list.

Subscribing

Head over to our group's mailing list signup page. It should look something like this.

Once you're on that page, fill in the form with your email address and name. No one except ACM officers and administrators can access this information, so it is fairly safe. You do not necessarily have to pick a password. If you haven't, a password will be mailed to you. You might not have to cisit this page often, so just in case you forgot the password you used, the following section will come of help.

Subscriptions are purged every semester so do sign up again at the beginning of every semeseter to recieve our weekly emails.

Password Reminders, Unsubscribing and other Subscription Options

Head back to the group's mailing list signup page and look for the field in the bottom. Fill in your email and hit the button to select an option to get a password reminder, unsibscribe or change other options.

Upcoming Events & Workshops

Current Workshop

Programming Competitions

Dmitrii Mudrechenko, Jeff McNertney

03 Feb 2015 at 5:00 pm

BR 165/166

Interested at proving your programming skills to others including potential employers? Programming Competitions are the perfect way to do that! In this informational workshop we will be covering the basics of what programming competitions are and what you should expect if you are attending one. Oh, and did I mention that you could score a job at Google for competing? That’s right! Google hosts one of the top programming competitions in the world, Code Jam. Interested but not sure if you got what it takes? Come anyways and show your interest! We’re even talking about setting up local practise competitions to help you out when it comes time to compete in larger competitions like Code Jam.

Next Workshop

Git Set Go!

Jake Humphrey & Jeff McNertney

10 Feb 2015 at 5:00 pm

BR 165/166

Git is a distributed version control system. It is one skill every software professional is bound to find necessary in their career. We use it here to run our website and do other cool stuff. You will learn how to manage your projects better with Git and be introduced to the popular code sharing website github.com.

Checkout All workshops & events

Hello!

Passionate about programming, games, robots, the web … ?
So are we! Join the ACM and participate by writing an article about your field of expertise, teaching and learning from your fellow students in our weekly workshops or attending presentations from local tech companies and computer professionals. We meet Wednesdays at 2pm in the Linux Lab. You should come!
